revised_title: Investigating the Phenomena of Larger Disturbances of Magnetic Declination at Kew Observatory
tldr: The author investigates the larger disturbances of magnetic declination at the Kew Observatory, analyzing photographic records from 1858 and 1859. The study reveals distinct laws governing westerly and easterly deflections, with easterly deflections predominantly occurring during nighttime hours and westerly deflections peaking at 6 AM and 3 PM.
